I try to build a operating system like desktop application by using the qx.ui.window.Desktop. for the main actions i created a toolbar at the bottom of the application, which also shows all open (qx.ui.window.Window) windows as buttons.
For highlighting the right window in the toolbar i added an change event called 'changeActiveWindow' to the qx.ui.window.MDesktop property 'activeWindow'. I added a listener to log the changes, so i discovered that the event is called twice: at the first time when a window loses the activ state (value: null for new, window_1 for old) and for the second time when a other window receives the activ state (value: window_2 for new, null for old). For being more reasonable the event should deliver a value window_2, window_1, without null.
